intro: Senecio chaquiroensis, commonly known as the Chaquiroensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio chaquiroensis is often found in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in full sun and minimal rainfall.
